sen.j: 長慶は織田信長と同じく堺市の経済力に目をつけたり、朝廷との関係を重んじてたびたび連歌会を開くなど、豊かな教養人でもあった。
sen.e: Like Nobunaga ODA, Nagayoshi was such a well-educated person that he focused on the economic power of Sakai City and often held the Renga-kai to pay particular attention to the relationship with the Imperial court.

sen.j: しかし、信長と違って幕府を滅ぼして上に立つのではなく、その影となって実権を掌握するということに、長慶の信長との違いを感じることができる。
sen.e: However, we sense a difference between Nobunaga and Nagayoshi because Nagayoshi wielded the real power through behaving as a power-broker rather than overthrowing the bakufu for the highest position.

sen.j: 長慶は父・三好元長の菩提を弔うため、弘治 (日本)3年（1557年）、臨済宗大徳寺派の寺院、龍興山南宗寺を長慶の尊敬する大徳寺90世大林宗套を開山として創建した。
sen.e: To mourn his father Motonaga MIYOSHI's bodhi, in 1557, Nagayoshi constructed Ryukozan-nanshu-ji Temple as one belonging to Rinzai-shu Daitoku-ji Temple sect for which Daitoku-ji Temple IX Soto DAIRIN who Nagayoshi had respected was determined as Kaizan (primary chief priest.)

To mourn his father Motonaga MIYOSHI's bodhi, in 1557, Nagayoshi constructed Ryukozan-nanshu-ji Temple under the auspices of the Rinzai-shu Daitoku-ji Temple sect, for which Daitoku-ji Temple IX Soto DAIRIN who Nagayoshi had respected was determined as Kaizan (primary chief priest).
sen.cmt: wording; the term bodhi is foreign to Westerners and should include a description.
sen.e: To mourn his father Motonaga MIYOSHI, in 1557, Nagayoshi constructed Nanshu-ji Temple on Mt. Ryuko under the auspices of Rinzai sect Daitoku-ji school, for which Daitoku-ji ninetieth Dairin Soto who Nagayoshi had respected was determined as kaisan (a founder of temple as the first chief priest).
sen.cmt: 文脈上、-'s bodhiは不要と考え、削除しました。龍興山南宗寺→Nanshu-ji Temple on Mt. Ryukoとしました。臨済宗大徳寺派→Rinzai sect Daitoku-ji school(用語集より）大徳寺90世大林宗套→Daitoku-ji ninetieth Dairin Soto としました。開山→kaisan (a founder of temple as the first chief priest) (用語集より)

sen.j: 茶人の武野紹鴎、千利休が修行し、沢庵宗彭が住職を務めたこともあり、堺の町衆文化の発展に寄与した寺院である。
sen.e: The temple was a place Cha-jin (master of ceremonial tea), Jo-oh TAKENO and SEN no Rikyu received their training and Soho TAKUAN was serving as chief priest, and significantly contributed to the development of the Machishu-bunka (bourgeois culture) in Sakai.

sen.j: 長慶は常に「百万の大軍は怖くないが、大林宗套の一喝ほど恐ろしいものはない」と常々語っていたほどに大林宗套に深く帰依しており、南宗寺の廻りは必ず下馬して歩いたといわれている。
sen.e: Nagayoshi was deeply devoted to Soto DAIRIN as he was always saying "I am not afraid of large armies of a million soldiers, but there is nothing as frightening as a reprimant from Soto DAIRIN," and therefore, it is believed that he always got off his horse to walk around Nanshu-ji Temple.

Nagayoshi was deeply devoted to Soto DAIRIN. He frequently said "I am not afraid of large armies of a million soldiers, but there is nothing as frightening as a reprimant from Soto DAIRIN". It is believed that he always dismounted from his horse to walk around Nanshu-ji Temple.

sen.e: Although assassination of Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA was planned by Hisahide MATSUNAGA before his death, he continued resisting the plan to the end.

sen.j: 優秀な弟たちにそれぞれの分国を支配させることで国人をまとめ上げ、最盛期には山城から伊予まで9カ国を支配下に置く戦国大名であった。
sen.e: In order to govern the Kokujin entirely, he directed each of his competent brothers to manage the respective countries, and in his prime, was a daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku Period who was placing even nine countries situated from Yamashiro through Iyo under his control.

sen.j: 文武の名将ではあるが、教養人の面のみを論う人もいたが本人は、「歌連歌ぬるきものぞと言うものの梓弓矢も取りたるもなし」と見事な和歌で反論している。
sen.e: Though he was a great commander excelling at both the path of military arts and that of literary arts, some were pointing out only aspects as an educated person, and he refuted such views by a distinguished Waka poem, 'A man who ridicules someone as a Renga poet is not brave as taking a bow and arrows.'

Though he was a great commander, excelling at both the paths of military arts and literary arts, some would overstress his educated character. He refuted these characterizations in a distinguished Waka poem, 'A man who ridicules someone as a Renga poet is not as brave as taking a bow and arrows'.
